en: Doth not wisdom cry, And understanding put forth her voice?
hmr: Varna chu a khêkin, Hrietthiemna chun a râwl ân suo a ni naw am a nih?

en: On the top of high places by the way, Where the paths meet, she standeth;
hmr: Lampui sîra hmun insânghaia chun, Lampui ṭhuom laihaia chun a ngîr a;

en: Beside the gates, at the entry of the city, At the coming in at the doors, she crieth aloud:
hmr: Khawpui lûtnaa, dâikawtkhâr sîrahai, Kawtkhâr lûtnaahai chun a khêk rak rak a;

en: Unto you, O men, I call; And my voice is to the sons of men.
hmr: “In kuomah, aw mihriemhai, ka khêk a, Ka râwl chu mihriem naupahai kuomah kân suo a nih.

en: O ye simple, understand prudence; And, ye fools, be of an understanding heart.
hmr: Aw nang mi mâwl, varna hung hrethiem ta la, Chun, nangni invêthai, hriet- thiemna lungril hung nei ro.

en: Hear, for I will speak excellent things; And the opening of my lips shall be right things.
hmr: Ngai ta u, thil ṭha bîkhai ka hril ding a ni sih a, Ka hmûrhai kâkna chu thil indik a ni ding a nih.

en: For my mouth shall utter truth; And wickedness is an abomination to my lips.
hmr: Ka bau chun thudik sâksuok a ta, Khawhlona chu ka hmûrhai ta dingin tirdakum a ni sih a.

en: All the words of my mouth are in righteousness; There is nothing crooked or perverse in them.
hmr: Ka baua thu po pohai chu felna a na, Annia chun a kâwi amanih, a khêl amani khawm a um nawh.

en: They are all plain to him that understandeth, And right to them that find knowledge.
hmr: A hrethiemtu ta ding chun a fie vawng a, Hrietna hmu suoktuhai ta ding chun ân dik vawng bawk a nih.

en: Receive my instruction, and not silver; And knowledge rather than choice gold.
hmr: Tangka ni loin, ka inchûktirna hi lo pawm ro, Rangkachak ditumtak nêkin hrietna chu lo chang bawk unla.

en: For wisdom is better than rubies; And all the things that may be desired are not to be compared unto it.
hmr: Lunghluhai nêkin varna chu a ṭha lem sih a; Thil po po dit thei taphawthai chu ama le hrilkhi ding a um nawh.

en: I wisdom have made prudence my dwelling, And find out knowledge and discretion.
hmr: Kei varna hin varna chu ka chêngnaah ka hmang a, Hrietna le ngairuotthiemna chu ka hmu suok a.

en: The fear of Jehovah is to hate evil: Pride, and arrogancy, and the evil way, And the perverse mouth, do I hate.
hmr: LALPA ṭi chu suolna theidana ding a na, Chapona le, insuklienna le rîtlona kawng leh, Bau chapo hi ka theida a nih.

en: Counsel is mine, and sound knowledge: I am understanding; I have might.
hmr: Thurâwnna chu ka ta a na, hrietna hrisêl leh, Hrethiemin ka um a, thilthawtheina ka nei a nih.

en: By me kings reign, And princes decree justice.
hmr: Lalhaiin keimain ro an rêl a, Lal nauhai chun keimain rorêl dik chu an sukthlûk bawk a.

en: By me princes rule, And nobles, even all the judges of the earth.
hmr: Rorêltuhai chun keimain ro an rêl a, Mi ṭhahai le, hnuoi chunga rorêltuhai po po chun.

en: I love them that love me; And those that seek me diligently shall find me.
hmr: A mi hmangaituhai chu ka hmangai veh a, Chun, nguntaka a mi zawngtuhai chun mi hmu suok bawk an tih.

en: Riches and honor are with me; Yea, durable wealth and righteousness.
hmr: Hausakna le inzâkaina chu ka kuomah a um a, Hausaknahai le felna tlotak el chu.

en: My fruit is better than gold, yea, than fine gold; And my revenue than choice silver.
hmr: Ka ra chu rângkachak nêkin, anih, rângkachak inthieng nêkin a ṭha lem a, Ka pungna khawm chu tangka ditumtak nêkin a ṭha lem.

en: I walk in the way of righteousness, In the midst of the paths of justice;
hmr: Felna lampuia chun ka feh a, Rorêlna lampuitakhaia chun.

en: That I may cause those that love me to inherit substance, And that I may fill their treasuries.
hmr: Kei a mi hmangaituhai chu thil nei dinga ka siem theina ding le, An sum inhai chu ka suksip theina dingin.

en: Jehovah possessed me in the beginning of his way, Before his works of old.
hmr: LALPA chun a lampui inṭanna angin a mi siem a, Inhmata a sinthawhai hmasatak angin.

en: I was set up from everlasting, from the beginning, Before the earth was.
hmr: Atîra inthawk, chatuona indinin ka um a, Hnuoi hrim la um hmain.

en: When there were no depths, I was brought forth, When there were no fountains abounding with water.
hmr: Tuipuihai a um naw laiin lâk suokin ka um a, Tuikhurhai tuia sipa umhai um naw lai chun.

en: Before the mountains were settled, Before the hills was I brought forth;
hmr: Tlânghai siemrêl an ni hmain, Muolhai hma daiin, lâk suok ka ni tah a;

en: While as yet he had not made the earth, nor the fields, Nor the beginning of the dust of the world.
hmr: Ramhai le hnuoi a la siem naw lai le, Khawvêl pilvut inṭan hma dai bawk chun.

en: When he established the heavens, I was there: When he set a circle upon the face of the deep,
hmr: Vânhai chu a buotsai lai chun, chutaka chun ka um a, Tuipui chung inkuol a siem lai chun;

en: When he made firm the skies above, When the fountains of the deep became strong,
hmr: Vâna sûmhai a siem laiin, Tuipui tuikhurhai chu a sukdet lai chun.

en: When he gave to the sea its bound, That the waters should not transgress his commandment, When he marked out the foundations of the earth;
hmr: Chuong lai chun tuipui ta dingin tiemchin a pêk a, Tuihai chun a thupêk chu an bawsiet nawna dingin, Leihnuoi lungphûmhai chu a ruot lai chun:

en: Then I was by him, as a master workman; And I was daily his delight, Rejoicing always before him,
hmr: Chuong lai chun amaa chun sinthaw hotu ang ka lo ni tah a; Chun, ama hmaa chun hlima um rawpin, Ni tina a lâwmna chu ka lo ni tah a.

en: Rejoicing in his habitable earth; And my delight was with the sons of men.
hmr: A leihnuoi chêng theinaa chun hlima umin, Ka lâwmna chu mihriem nau- pahai chungah a ni tah a.

en: Now therefore, my sons, hearken unto me; For blessed are they that keep my ways.
hmr: Chuleiin, tuhin, ka naupa- salhai mi lo ngai unla, Ka lampui hrawtuhai chu mi hamṭha an ni sih a.

en: Hear instruction, and be wise, And refuse it not.
hmr: Inchûktirna chu ngai unla, var unla, Dit naw hrim hrim naw ro.

en: Blessed is the man that heareth me, Watching daily at my gates, Waiting at the posts of my doors.
hmr: Ka thu hretu chu mi hamṭha a nih, Ka dâikawtkhâra ni tina nghâktu, Ka kawtkhâr bienga nghâk zingtu chu.

en: For whoso findeth me findeth life, And shall obtain favor of Jehovah.
hmr: Tukhawm a mi hmu suoktu chun hringna chu a hmu suok a, LALPA ditsakna chu chang a tih.

en: But he that sinneth against me wrongeth his own soul: All they that hate me love death.
hmr: Amiruokchu, ka chunga suksuol chun ama lungril ngei a sukkhawhlo a, Kei a mi theidatuhai po po chun thina an hmangai a nih.”
